column13: blurb

Chris died on the street in York on 2 October. The 46 year-old was sleeping in the doorway of a shoe shop. Messages of sadness were expressed by people who knew him. One woman wrote: “Tragic, only speaking to him on Sunday. Can’t believe this.”

James has reportedly commited suicide in a hotel in Croydon, the day before his stay in temporary accommodation was due to run out. A report from Lambeth Clinical Commissioning Group (CCG) said: “He [Mr Abbott] said his primary need was accommodation and if this was provided he would not have an inclination to end his life.”
Passed away in hosptial after being in for two weeks. Cause: Organ Failure.

Alan often frequented the Dark Arches near Leeds train station, according to local news reports. Haydn Jessop, from Leeds Homeless Partnership, was reported as saying: “Alan was known as ‘gentle giant’ - that was his nickname. “He was never any bother for anybody.” More than 50 people gathered for a candlelit memorial in his memory.

A young man, thought to be 21, was found underneath an archway in Madeira Drive at 8.50am on 29 October 2017. According to a local man who knew him, the deceased had been battling mental health problems and drug addiction.

Forty-two year old Tomasz was found dead under a railway bridge in Blackburn. According to news reports he had been drinking heavily before his death. Born in Poland he had been sleeping rough for some time. A coroner’s report noted fatal levels of blood alcohol.
Street homeless, drug overdose.

Known locally as 'Punk Paul', Paul Larner died on the streets age 50. He was struggling with addiction, reportedly using spice, and had previously spoken of his issues with alcohol. In 2009 he told the Bristol Post: “Because alcohol is cheap and in plentiful supply, it’s the worst addiction of all.”
Died while in long term temporary accommodation.
Geordie died the week before Alan Cambell (see his separate entry). Little is know about him or his death, but a candle vigil for him and Alan attracted 50 well-wishers.

Chris was 31 when he died in November 2017. Chris, who was known as 'Bower', became homeless after the death of his mother and brother. Local residents who knew him said he prioritised food for his dog over himself. Greater Manchester Police say there were no suspicious circumstances surrounding Chris’ death. A GoFundMe page set up to pay for Chris’ funeral raised more than £2,200.

Aaron, 28, died after falling from a fifth floor balcony, in suspicious circumstances. Staff at a night centre he would use, called him 'popular' saying: “Aaron was always helpful, polite and courteous to the staff team, volunteers and fellow guests”. A man was arrested and later bailed in connection to his death.

Thirty-two year old Lindy was found dead in Alexandra Gardens in Cardiff nine days before Christmas 2017. She was living in a tent with her partner Michael, he found her dead in the tent. She had chronic obstructive pulmonary disease. “It’s been a blur, I don’t know what’s going on, I don’t know where to turn,” Michael told a reporter from Channel 4 news. Her sister Leezette said she was waiting on news on the cause of death. Lindy’s was the 21st homeless death in Cardiff in three years.
Died of sepsis.
Had been in emergency accommodation but had just found a more permanent room. Suspected cause of death was complications caused by alcohol.
Suspected drug overdose. Evicted day before death from emergency accommodation.

Neculai was a Big Issue seller. He had lived in the UK for 10 years but lost his job four years ago. He had been sleeping rough and in shelters since. Concerned about his health, local residents started crowdfunding to help pay for medical treatment, but Neculai died on 5 December.

A 46 year old man went into cardiac arrest while staying at Brighter Futures’ Hope Street hostel in Hanley, Stoke. A month after the death, city officials were criticised for removing homeless people’s tents.

Scottish born Brodie died aged 31, in the closed doorway of a shut Salvation Army office in Falmouth, on 6 December 2017. His close friend Louise Picktahll told local news Cornwall Live: "Brodie was one of the most genuine people around. He never cared for materialistic things, designer clothing or television. His passion was music and travelling around the UK meeting new people and living life to the fullest." A crowdfunding page was setup to help pay for this funeral.

Paul was found dead on the streets outside the Bullring Shopping Centre in Birmingham, following a cardiac arrest. The 38 year old was found by a homeless-outreach officer called Rob Yasai. “When I pulled the blankets away I found he had basically frozen to death,” Rob said.

Christopher, who was in his 60s, died in a packed homeless shelter on Christmas Eve. A volunteer for Crisis described finding his body. “He lay down under a blanket on the floor in the sleeping area and never got up again,” wrote Ros Ponder on Facebook. “No one should be taking their last breath in a place like this - on the floor of a sports hall, in a makeshift dormitory shared with 130 other people who had nowhere else to go,” she continued.

Thirty-year-old John Smith was found dead on Christmas Day, in a hostel in Chester. John was from Glasgow and was believed to have arrived in Chester around three years ago. Head of a local homelessness charity, Cllr Rob Bisset reacted to John’s death saying: “It’s a crying shame. It’s a difficult situation we are facing on the streets at the moment. John was a likeable member of the homeless community and it’s sad he’s lost his life at such a young age.”
David’s body was found inside a derelict building on Boxing Day night. The 41 year-old, was found on 4 January. The cause of death will be explored at an inquest.

Alan died while sleeping rough in a car park in Taunton, on Boxing Day 2017. A fellow rough sleeper, Charles Gorst told local news: "We'd been moved on from a number of places by the police, accused of begging. We went to sleep on the top layer of the car park. I had a quilt, but Alan didn't have anything except the clothes he was in. It was really cold and raining heavily. We were wet through. There was nowhere we could go for help.” Alan was from Glasgow but had lived in Taunton for around 10 years.
Died in hospital but was living on the streets.

Died in hospital aged 48, after years sleeping rough. The former soldier had an infection and a stroke. According to local news reports he had served with the 2nd Royal Tank Regiment, the Royal Army Pay Corps and the Adjutant General's Corps. He became homeless after leaving the army.
Nigel, who died a few days before Christmas was known as a "gentle giant" according to reports in the Yorkshire Evening Post.
Louise was known to be sleeping rough near a shopping precinct in Bognor Regis. Her death prompted messages of sympathy on social media.

Neil was found dead in his tent, in a carpark in Maidstone. He had suffered a stroke years ago and used a stick to walk. He was 49 when he died. He was found on 2 January, as the UK was in the midst of extremely cold weather brought in by Storm Eleanor.
Fifty-six year old Fiona was found collapsed in the Dark Arches in Leeds, the same place where Alan Cambell (see separate entry) died less than three months earlier.
Found unresponsive in her bedroom. An ambulance was called. Declared deased on arrival at hospital, cause: Pneumonia.

Matthew was found dead in a city centre park. The night before he died he had told a charity shelter worker how he hoped he could volunteer for the project some day. He had been staying at the One Roof Leicester shelter since December, he was found on 12 January. “He would often offer sweets or biscuits to everyone in the shelter, sharing what little he had. “He enjoyed taking part in the recreational activities that were available at the shelter, in particular card games and Jenga,” shelter worker Salma Ravat told the local press.
Laura had recently moved into temporary accomodation - she had been unwell and died a few weeks later.

Sixty-six year old 'Kev' was found under a flyover in a car park in Bournemouth. A man who knew him told local reporters that the council had taken away Kev’s sleeping bag days earlier, a suggestion the council strongly refutes.
Passed away in Kings College Hospital after being in for one week. Cause: Vascular disease.
DS passed away in a room after receiving palliative care after leaving hospital.
A man died in hospital 11 days after falling in a scalding hot bath, in a homeless shelter in Southall, Windsor. His family have asked that he not be identified.
Honda was found dead on the streets in Sheffield City Centre on 29 January. It is believed Honda had been sleeping rough for around 12 years, he was 38 when he died.
Living in long-term, temporary accommodation.

Steve was found dead on the streets, at a derelict plot of land in Dudley. He had been sleeping in a tent at the site for several weeks. Local MP, Ian Austin, said: "It's a scandal that homeless people are dying on the streets in Britain today.”
A man in his 40s died while sleeping in a church hall to avoid the freezing weather. In his 40s, the man was a rough sleeper in Colchester. He died on 3 February 2018 of natural causes.
Adam was found unconscious outside a Debenhams store in Bristol.
Gareth died after spending the last two weeks of his life in a hospital. He was a familar face in the town centre and many in the homeless community in Milton Keynes mourned his death.

The death of Marcos Amaral Gourgel, who was often seen in Westminster Tube station, made headlines in February. A former model, news reports suggest he had been jailed for child abuse. He was found dead in an underpass, metres from the Houses of Parliament.
An unidentified man was found dead, sleeping rough on a mattress in -5C in central Edinburgh.

Canadian-born Rob O’Connor died in a shop doorway on a night when temperatures dropped to -2C. Rob had recently undergone treatment for cancer and had his voice box removed. Jeremy Corbyn, leader of the Labour Party, responded to the death saying: “This is so sad and can't be allowed to continue.”
Danny had been living on the streets for several years. He died in the home of a local resident who had offered him a warm place during Storm Emma. An inquest is set to take place.

Ben died in his tent in freezing weather conditions, in early March. He was 53 and had only recently been discharged from hospital after being treated for pneumonia. According to a local woman who knew him, Ben had worked as a bricklayer but had stopped working after the death of his partner seven years earlier.
A 19 year-old man was found dead in a park in Cardiff.
A man in his 60s died minutes after leaving a homeless emergency shelter on a freezing March morning. Temperatures had dropped to -10C overnight. The man left the shelter and collapsed in a doorway.

Robert, 41, was found dead in his sleeping bag, at a homeless shelter. His mother, Eileen Wallis, was also staying at the centre. Eileen described to local news how she had found him dead: “I woke up and reached out for his hand but it felt really cold...I knew he was ill, but this came completely out of the blue and I am devastated. I have no idea what my future holds now.”

Valerie was found dead in a car park behind Peterborough Town Hall in early March 2018. She was well known by local residents and had set up a makeshift garden of potted plants by shop entrances. She had two daughters and two grandchildren.
Henryk (as named by a fellow rough sleeper), 62, was found dead in Plymouth city centre. He was believed to have been Polish and friends say he was a physicist and mathematician.
Shelly collapsed in the street. She was taken to hospital but later died. Hundreds of people paid tribute to her online.
Body of a man was found in a rear yard, an area used by rough sleepers. Death not thought to be suspicious.

The man in his mid-40s is thought to have died shortly after 2.15am on Tuesday morning, on a pavement outside Curry’s PC World on London’s busy Tottenham Court Road. The death came just days after around 100 rough sleepers were evicted from a disused building nearby, which had been turned into a makeshift shelter by volunteers hoping to protect the homeless community during freezing temperatures in March.
Hamid, a quantum physicist who fought in Iraq, was living in the back of his car in a Tesco car park. He moved to a shelter during the cold weather and passed away there.
column22: Talking to people who knew him, we can confirm is name is Hamid and not Hamed as stated in the article.

column13: Suspected drug overdose.
A man in his 50s died of a suspected drug overdose.
Cause unknown.
Lesley Roberts, 56, who died in hospital surrounded by her family, was described as "one of the lovely gems of Swansea homeless."
Dan was reportedly found deceased in a tent on the Swindon College's campus.
